name: S1: Ep 12/13 "Tommy A" & "Running the Max" Trivia Quiz | Television | 10 Questions
tags: Saved By The Bell: The New Class

questions.text: Ep 12: Who didn't have a driver's license yet?
questions.explanation:
Scott.

	He had a girl agree to go on a date with him until she found out that he couldn't drive. At the same time, several of his friends were complaining about being forced to ride the school bus. Tommy D was then informed that his dad was buying him a car.

questions.text: Ep 12: What event was happening at the school the week of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Mid Year Finals.

	Weasel had a dream that finals were that week and he'd forgotten to study. Scott told him that they were that week and Weasel freaked out that he hadn't studied. The test in their English class was to give a speech.

questions.text: Ep 12: What subject did the group decide to try to get everyone else to fail?
questions.explanation:
Physics.

	Tommy D had to get an A in at least one subject in order to get his dad to give him the car he had been promised. The physics teacher graded on a curve, so they tried to convince people to cheat and get a bad grade (by convincing them that Weasel was giving them codes based on a cough or a sneeze).

questions.text: Ep 12: Who was acting dumb to get a date?
questions.explanation:
Megan.

	She really wanted to date a guy who didn't notice she existed. Her friend overheard him say that he didn't like smart girls. She started acting dumb, and they started dating. Eventually, she realized that she had to be herself and decided it wasn't worth acting dumb to be his girlfriend.

questions.text: Ep 12: Did Tommy get the grade needed to make his dad happy?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	He gave a speech about believing in himself. Mr. Belding gave him an "A" for it. Belding was teaching the class because the regular teacher had gone home on an "emergency", to care for his flower garden.

questions.text: Ep 13: What sport was being advertised in the opening scene?
questions.explanation:
Volleyball.

	Scott was in the hall flirting with a girl as the episode opened. A large sign advertising the next volleyball game was hanging about the lockers. The bell rang, Scott was late for Mr. Tuttle's Social Studies class. Luckily he had fake late passes.

questions.text: Ep 13: Who was subbing for Mr. Tuttle?
questions.explanation:
Mr. Belding

	Belding was leading the class as Scott walked in. Mr. Tuttle had called off of work to watch Oprah. He was watching "Teacher's Who Overeat" week on the show.Belding was played by Dennis Haskins

questions.text: Ep 13: Because he was late to class, Scott got to join a group of his choosing for the project.
questions.explanation:
False.

	He was forced to join the only group that didn't already have six members. The project was running a local business for a week. Group 1 had a dumbbell store, Group 2 got The Max (the hangout for the kids) and Group 3 got to run the International House of Dry Cleaning. He tricked someone into switching groups with him though and ended up working at the Max.

questions.text: Ep 13: What sport's banquet was moved after Scott convinced the coach the original venue was a bad idea?
questions.explanation:
Football.

	Coach promised Scott that if the banquet wasn't a huge success that he'd be doing pushups until his arm fell off. The banquet was going to cost $600 to put on, and the coach was paying $2,000 for the service. Leaving a tidy profit if all went well. Other than Weasel the rest of the staff quit on Scott after he was working them too hard

questions.text: Ep 13: What was the theme of the party the group hosted?
questions.explanation:
Hoedown.

	The football coach didn't think his team would like it, but they surprised him. Coach and Mr. Belding both congratulated the team on a project well done. At the end of the week, the group still lost $9 rather than turning a profit.
